docs.title: Welcome to vscode-basex (v0.1)
docs.text:
vscode-basex is a vscode extension providing support for development using BaseX. BaseX is a Java based XQuery processor.

Warning

This extension is "Work in progress". Errors and changes to be expected.

Information about installing this extension is here.

docs.title: Javascript
docs.text:
/* eslint-disable @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires */

const XQLint =require("@quodatum/xqlint").XQLint;
const CodeFormatter=require( "@quodatum/xqlint").CodeFormatter;
console.log("....");
const xquery="2 +4 ";
const linter = new XQLint(xquery, { "styleCheck": false }) ;

//if(linter.hasSyntaxError()+linter.hasSyntaxError()) throw new Error("XQuery syntax error")
const ast=linter.getAST()
const formatter = new CodeFormatter(ast);
const formatted = formatter.format().trim();
console.log(formatted);

docs.title: Settings (15)
docs.text: Settings can be viewed and set from the extensions view.

docs.title: processor
docs.text:
The XQuery processor. Determines syntax and core module libraries.

default: basex-9

docs.title: showHovers
docs.text:
Show hovers in XQuery source. Currently these show just Diagnostic info.

default: false

docs.title: suppressErrors
docs.text: Lint Error messages including these strings are marked as info rather than error. TEMP HACK! [XQST0059],[XPST0008]

docs.title: executionArguments
docs.text: Arguments to be passed to the XQuery execution engine.

docs.title: executionEngine
docs.text: The path to the executable to run when standalone BaseX. e.g ... \basex.bat

docs.title: ignoreDefaultNamespace
docs.text:
Ignore default xmlns attributes when evaluating XPath.

default: true

docs.title: persistXPathQuery
docs.text:
Remember the last XPath query used.

default: true

docs.title: enforcePrettySelfClosingTagOnFormat
docs.text:
Enforces a space before the forward slash at the end of a self-closing XML tag.

default: false

docs.title: removeCommentsOnMinify
docs.text:
Remove XML comments during minification.

default: false

docs.title: splitAttributesOnFormat
docs.text:
Put each attribute on a new line when formatting Overrides splitXmlnsOnFormat if set to true.

default: false

docs.title: splitXmlnsOnFormat
docs.text:
Put each xmlns attribute on a new line when formatting XML.

default: true

docs.title: FormatterImplementation
docs.text: Supported XML Formatters: * classic * v2

docs.title: enableTreeView
docs.text:
Enables the XML Document view in the explorer for XML documents.

default: false

docs.title: enableViewMetadata
docs.text:
Enables attribute and child element counts in the XML Document view.

default: true

docs.title: enableViewCursorSync
docs.text:
Enables auto-reveal of elements in the XML Document view when a start tag is clicked in the editor.

default: false

docs.title: Extension debugging
docs.text: Virtual documents showing the XML parse tree and the XQDoc data can be created when the active document is of type XQuery. These may help analysing problems with the extension.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: Code completion suggestions can be triggered by Ctl-space

docs.title: Details
docs.text: There are several types of completion. The context position is used to determine which to run.

docs.title: Type completions
docs.text: If the previous token was as then type completions are displayed. Examples include: * let $a as| * declare variable $a as| * declare function local:f( $a as| * declare function local:f( $a as item()) as|
